summary: Me, an avid Tony lover: yknow Tony's actions in aou were kind of problematic and I'm glad he took accountability for them at...
body:
Me, an avid Tony lover: yknow Tony’s actions in aou were kind of problematic and I’m glad he took accountability for them at least. I love his character, but he is not without his flaws.

Y'all: mAN fuCK Tony what he did is UNFORGIVABLE he is a MONSTER and we UNSTAN

Me, and avid Steve lover: Yknow Steve’s actions in CW were kind of problematic, he hurt a lot of people but ig that shows that he isn’t the perfect man we all think he is and that’s okay with me, I still love him

Y'all: we LOVE Steve team CAP all the way, you see what he did for Bucky?? STUCKY IS REAL. MY MAN STEVE CAN DO NO WRONG 😤

masterlist

body:
Defeat

PAIRING: TONY STARK X READER

word count: 800 it’s short

warning: mention of death i think

summary: tony is haunted by the outcome of the fight with thanos and can’t sleep.

a/n: i tried writing fluff

masterlist

He couldn’t sleep.

He tossed and turned in his bed, sweat dripping off his forehead.

“Mr Stark, I don’t feel so good.” He turned around, only to see the young man’s face turned pale with fear “You’re alright” He approached him, and cradled his head as Peter stumbled to the ground.

Ever since he came back, he just couldn’t sleep.

They lost.

It’s not like they hadn’t lost a war before. What would you call Sokovia? Yeah, they defeated Ultron, but did they win? Can a war with that many casualties be labelled a victory? The mess that revolved around the Sokovian Accords? They only made the things worse. No one won. Everyone lost. Everyone lost a part of their family.

But this was different. This time, it wasn’t even a fight that could be fixed. Last time, everyone was alive, just scattered around the world. Now?

Now half the world is dead.

“I don’t wanna go, Mr Stark please, I don’t-“

That’s it. He opened his eyes, tossed the covers on the floor, standing up and leaving the room. He entered the kitchen to make himself a cup of coffee.

“Why don’t you just install one in your room? Less walking every damn night.” She called from the couch.

Tony grinned slightly, filling his cup. “What’s keeping you up?” he asked.

Y/N looked at him, leaning her head sideways, “Can you believe it was a year ago?”

He took a sip from his coffee, popping on the couch next to her. She brought her legs closer to herself only to let them land in his lap. “Seems like yesterday.”

“It’s unbelievable how the world went to shit so quickly.”

Sipping from his coffee again, his stare unfocused in the dark of the room. His mind was constantly replaying everything that happened over and over again.

“Stop beating yourself over it.” she finally said, breaking the silence. “It’s not your fault.”

“I could’ve done more.” he said, swallowing a thick nothing.

“We all could’ve. No point beating yourself over it now.” she said, supporting her head with her hand against the back of the couch.

“You think it’ll get better?” he asked, glancing in her direction.

She raised an eyebrow “Only if we stop swimming in the shallow ends of what happened. I’m not saying forget it, of course, because it defined the future but just stop living in what would’ve happened if we stopped him.” she curled a corner of her lips, before shrugging her shoulders “We gotta work on what we can do now, not what we could do.”

“That’s actually not a that bad point.” he said, in a serious tone.

“Not a that bad point?” she replied “You really need sleep.”

He sighed, getting up and walking towards the coffee machine again “Which you’re not gonna get if you continue drinking coffee in such unhealthy amounts.” she warned.

“Trust me, I would love to sleep more than anything. I just can’t.” He said eyeing the fluid filling his cup. “I see him every time I close my eyes. Every time, I return there, to that day. I see him turning to dust. I see May’s face once she realised he won’t be coming home and… I’m tired.”

Out of all the deaths that happened a year ago, Peter’s was the most traumatising one. He couldn’t help but feel like the fact that he brought him in on the team contributed to his death, even though it wasn’t being on the team that had killed him.

But again, if he hadn’t been on the team, he would’ve died at home. He wouldn’t be scattered around an abandoned planet in the middle of nowhere.

Y/N got up from the couch, and walked towards Tony, embracing him in a reassuring hug.

“C-coffee.” he muttered under his breath, balancing the mug between them.

She rolled her eyes, taking the mug away and spilling it in the sink. “You’re going to bed, stat.”

He stared at her, not sure if she had listened to anything he had just said “I’m sorry, but I don’t feel like reliving everything again.”

She took his hand in hers “You don’t have to be alone.”

He hesitated, trying to turn around on his heel.

“I’m serious, Tones.” she said, in a voice with a hint of anger. “This… I know what it feels like when you can’t sleep. When you just can’t bring yourself to calm down. You do not have to be alone in it.”

She squeezed his hand harder “Trust me.”

He sighed, letting her lead him out of the room and upstairs to his bedroom.

“Y/N?” he murmured into her hair, his arm wrapped around her waist.

She drew circles with her thumb on his back. “Hm?”

“Thank you.”

A huge smile took over her face “Don’t mention it.”

blog.name: ao3feed-tonystark
blog.title: Ao3-Feed: Tony Stark
blog.description: This blog is an automated list of the stories posted on Archive Of Our Own under the Tony Stark tag. The stories are automatically posted here from the AO3 RSS feed.

summary: Off To See The Tower, The Wonderful Tower Of Stark.
title: Off To See The Tower, The Wonderful Tower Of Stark.
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2PMc4Uk

by spiderlings

⠀⠀If Wanda Maximoff was to listen into the reveries of Peter Parker in the exact moment his eyes scanned the letter, she’d get more than a giggle listening to him recite a vine he found to fit all too well; Shit, shit, shit, shit, shit. Shit, shit, shit, shit. Shit, shit, shit, shit, fuck. Fuck, fuck, fuck, fuck. Fuck, fuck, fuck, fuck. Fuck, fuck, fuck, fuck, shit ( he’d definitely get a scolding from Steve Rogers if she snitched on him ).

⠀⠀Much to the discomfort of the young Parker, the top of the parchment screamed five words which he cursed with everything inside of him: FIELD TRIP TO STARK TOWERS! Ned Leeds gave a silent laugh to the boy, and he could hear the hiss-like chuckle rolling off the viperine lingua of Eugene ‘Flash’ Thompson. Ah, the joys of being a teenager with senses always dialled up to eleven that came with the freaky spider powers he acquired upon a freak accident.

—— Or, Peter takes a trip to Stark Tower and curses the world for not swallowing him whole.

Words: 6783, Chapters: 1/1, Language: English

  • Fandoms: Marvel Cinematic Universe, Spider-Man: Homecoming (2017), The Avengers (Marvel Movies)
  • Rating: Teen And Up Audiences
  • Warnings: No Archive Warnings Apply
  • Categories: F/F, F/M, M/M
  • Characters: Peter Parker, Michelle Jones, Ned Leeds, Tony Stark, Steve Rogers, James “Bucky” Barnes, Sam Wilson (Marvel), Stephen Strange, Wanda Maximoff, Clint Barton, Natasha Romanov (Marvel), Bruce Banner, Shuri (Marvel), Flash Thompson
  • Relationships: Ned Leeds & Peter Parker, Michelle Jones & Ned Leeds & Peter Parker, Michelle Jones/Peter Parker, Peter Parker & Avengers Team, Peter Parker & Tony Stark, James “Bucky” Barnes/Steve Rogers, Tony Stark/Stephen Strange
  • Additional Tags: rated teen and up because there’s a lot of swearing, like 27 out of the first 80 words are swearing, Field Trip, Not Captain America: Civil War (Movie) Compliant, Tony Stark Acting as Peter Parker’s Parental Figure, Ned Leeds is a Good Bro, Peter has a crush, there’s ironstrange if you squint, Not Avengers: Infinity War Part 1 (Movie) Compliant, Not Beta Read, Peter is a Little Shit, i forgot thor oops, so i had to mention him, because i didn’t wanna have to rewrite it all, My First AO3 Post, bus girl is a stucky shipper, and me too, flash thompson is a dick, Peter Parker’s Field Trip to Stark Industries, Domestic Avengers, he should’ve stayed on the bus, i think that’s all, How Do I Tag

title: Celebrity Couples Interview
body:
fandom: Stony (Steve x Tony), hinted Bruclintasha and Winterfalcon, MCU

summary: Tony and Steve take part in an interview about their relationship.

length: 2 160 words

a/n: this is inspired by real-life events, it was one of the games we played during one bachelorette party and since then I wanted to turn it into a fic. hope you will like it!

——————–

Celebrity Couples Interview

“It is on, it is on!” Clint yelled, ceasing the chatter and bringing everyone’s attention to the enormous TV set and the starting show. The show opened with glimpses of interviews, showing funny or memorable moments in a retrospective, many famous faces appearing on the screen.

“I can’t believe you don’t remember giving this interview,” Steve murmured, looking at his husband with gentle bewilderment, that hid a lot of fondness. Actually, he could believe that. Tony seemed to never pay a lot of mind about what he was telling to the press, almost as if he didn’t have any filter. He probably didn’t.

“Well, I don’t!” Tony called, mouth stretched into a smile, as he was safely nestled in Steve’s arms, the couple taking up their favorite spot on the couch. “I give a lot of interviews, don’t expect me to remember each and one of them—”

“Hope you said some dirty details!” Clint grinned, making himself more comfortable between Nat and Bruce, the three of them seated on the second couch.

“Thought you hated hearing about that,” Natasha pointed out.

“No, I hate when I walk on them because neither of them can keep it in their pants. Hearing about it on national TV is different.”

“Don’t count on it, Tony is always so suave and discreet,” Bruce added in a serious tone, that contradicted a teasing smile.

“Unlike Steve. He can’t handle a camera in his face,” Bucky murmured from his splayed on the floor position, with his face smushed into Sam’s bicep. The Winter Soldier didn’t sleep well in the last days.

Sam laughed, jostling Bucky a bit who grumbled loudly in protest. Like a sleepy bear. “Can’t wait to see him get all red and splutter words out. Please tell me that will happen.”

“Hey, shhh!” Natasha shushed her friends when the name of the show disappeared from the screen and the blonde host showed, smiling in greeting.

“Welcome to the Celebrity Couples Interview! This time we have a real treat for you, the first superhero couple who public deemed with the proud name Superhusbands, also known as Stony—”

“Aw, Stony is a cute name,” Sam laughed, sending Steve a wide smile. “Kinda makes you imagine stone statues of you two all over New York.”

“No,” Steve said quickly, shaking his head for double emphasis, just at the moment Tony opened his mouth. No statues.

“It is a noble term, my friends,” Thor rumbled from his favorite armchair.

“Hey, there goes Steve!” Sam yelled, ceasing the chatter and pointing at the screen with the image of a path in the park. It was almost empty and the sun wasn’t too high yet and dew was sparkling on the grass.

“Hey! There he is! Go go go!”

The camera angle changed and the pace quickened as two people started running. Soon, Steve’s silhouette appeared in the camera’s view, as he was during his morning jog, wearing a grey, clingy t-shirt and drawstring pants.

The team whistled, and Steve blushed a bit at that. Captain America looked good in tight clothes.

“Captain! Captain Rogers! May we have a word with you?!”

Steve turned around, temporarily jogging in place, blinking surprised at the camera. Usually when people jog they turn red and sweaty and disgusting. Steve wasn’t one of them. His face was just a bit pink, and his hair got a little bit damp near the hairline. His lips were flushed, as Steve had a habit of licking his lips while working out. It wasn’t a typical workout look. Steve looked hot and sweet, like a freshly baked cinabbon.

“That’s my husband,” Tony said proudly, grunting at the elbow aimed at his stomach from the said husband.

Back on the screen, Steve showed all of his teeth in a wide smile, a quite unusual reaction at seeing a camera when it came to him.

“Sure! If you can catch me, that is!” after the words, Steve turned around and zoomed out from the view, camera soon on him, showing his silhouette getting smaller and smaller.

“Noo! Captain, please wait!” more footsteps and the clinking of high heels the presenter wore was perfectly hearable. The image of the presenter and cameraman, chasing Captain America made the team laugh.

“Little shit,” Sam commented the behavior and Tony smiled at Steve’s mischievous, yet somehow proud smile.

“Mister Stark!”

The TV showed Tony, walking out of one of the coffee places in downtown, holding a stainless steel coffee cup with an outline of Captain America shield pressed on the side. He was in a formal, dark blue suit, with a white shirt underneath and a tie. There was even a handkerchief in his breast pocket, and the look was completed with expensive sunglasses and even more expensive wristwatch, matching the whole set. A true businessman at his finest.

“Oh, were you between meetings?” Steve asked, and Tony paused for a second, before looking away.

“Yeah, between meetings,” Tony agreed, not sounding too convincing and Steve only narrowed eyes. Tony better hope that Pepper was not watching this show.

“Mister Stark, can we have a word with you?”

The on-screen Tony slowly lowered his sunglasses, brown eyes sparkling in the sun. He smiled slowly, one corner of his lips going higher than the other, accented by the sharp and fresh angles of his goatee.

“Sure.”

“You would just agree to anything to stay away from SI meetings,” Natasha chimed in, clearly seeing how on-screen Tony planned to take his sweet time with answering questions and having an excuse for being late.

“Time for the questions!” Wanda called, holding a bowl of popcorn for her and Pietro to share. The formula of the show was with the presenter asking questions sent by fans to the couple in a separate time and finding out if the answers matched. Sometimes there was some task at the end, but not always.

“What would your partner take with him to a deserted island?”

The first question showed on the screen on a polka dot background, written out in colorful letters. Classic one, really.

Steve was the first one to answer. The cameraman finally caught on him, and the interview was filmed with Steve leaning over a barrier, on a background of rising sun and its reflection in a nearby pond. The sun rays sparkled in Steve’s hair and the blue in his eyes looked calm, giving a serene feeling.

“Hey, he is not blushing and stuttering,” Bucky complained, disappointed with the lack of Steve’s usual nervousness in front of the camera. On contrary, his friend looked good and surprisingly relaxed.

“Maybe they photoshopped him,” Sam said, getting a chuckle out of the team.

“It is just good camera work,” Tony added, hearing Steve grunt behind him. “What? We both know you get camera shy. Don’t worry, not everyone can look so effortlessly pretty like me during filming.”

“Effortlessly,” Steve repeated in a mocking voice. He knew first hand the long hours Tony spent in the bathroom each evening, rubbing numerous oils and lotions into different body parts. Tony just shook his head in warning, not allowing the other man to expand that topic.

“Well, Tony can make pretty amazing things from basically nothing…”

The voice coming from the TV focused everyone’s attention back on the screen. The on-screen Steve started to talk.

“I think he would take a rope, a knife and— that’s it. That’s all he needs. He could get the rest on the island.”

“Good thing you didn’t say matches, I could make a fire on my own,” Tony grinned, pleased with the answer.

“Of course you could,” Steve agreed for the sake of agreeing, hearing a displeased murmur from their teammates. Where was the dirt?

“Hmmm… Steve would take…”

The screen switched showing Tony. Everyone looked hopeful, hoping for some juicer answer.

“He would take a rope—”

“Boring!” Clint hollered, as it seemed that the question would be answered in the same practical way as Steve did.

“— and lube and me.”

Oh.

“We would have some good time.”

The on-screen Tony nonchalantly sipped his coffee, while the real-life Tony opened his mouth in shock in a general murmur of approval coming from the team. He didn’t remember saying that. Steve also gaped at the TV, feeling his face burn.

From that point, it only got worse.

“What is your favorite thing in your partner?” the second question showed in bold letters.

“Oh gosh,” Steve smiled sweetly and scratched the back of his head, looking shy. It would be innocent if the movement didn’t pronounce his enormous biceps, which seemed like a very fan-service moment. “Tony is smart, caring and funny. He is a whole package. I love everything about him, so I guess Tony altogether is my favorite thing.”

“Sappy,” Pietro gruffed, while Wanda cooed, like most of the team. Bucky made some gagging noise over the sweetness, and Steve aimed a light kick at his friend’s back.

Then the TV showed Tony.

“His *BLEEP*,” the on-screen Tony blurted out without a second of hesitation. Although the word was censored, the mouth movement was clear and the whole team burst into laughter. “Okay, I am joking,” Tony backtracked, smiling charmingly. “His heart. He is a good man. But he does have an amazing *BLEEP*.”

“What?” Tony asked in a shaky voice, getting nervous under Steve’s reprimanding look. “I fixed it!”

“You definitely did,” Clint cackled.

Steve feared for the last question. Well, not a question…

“Whaaat?” the on-screen Steve laughed nervously, his eyes crinkling. “No, no way. I am not doing it.”

Ah, so it was a task.

“Really?” Tony said, lowering his sunglasses again. “You really want me to do it?” he asked, his smile and whole posture giving away that he would.

The team held its breath waiting for the reveal what the task could be.

On the screen on a cheerful background of colorful stripes showed the last question of the interview. A task.

“Pretend that what you are holding is your partner and make out with it.”

The on-screen Steve looked at the water bottle in his hand.

“No,” he denied taking part in the challenge looking harshly into the camera, an embarrassed smile quickly following. “No,” he repeated, shaking his head.

“Alright,” the on-screen Tony nodded enthusiastically. “Just come with the camera closer. Like, get my whole face in. Closer. Perfect.”

And so on the background of a busy New York street, Tony put the coffee cup closer to his face and closed his eyes. A tip of a pink tongue touched the bottom and then slowly traced all the way up, going up the middle of the shield on the cup, lingering at the rim and doing a half circle. Then he tipped the cup all the way up, holding it almost vertically, downing down the contents in big gulps, his neck stretched and Adam’s apple moving temptingly.

The room turned very, very quiet. When Tony was done, he lowered the cup with a satisfied breath and wiped his shiny lips with a top of a hand. All the time looking into the camera.

There would be gifsets of this for sure all over the Internet soon.

The show was ending and the team started cheering and commenting, congratulating the couple a good show. Both Steve and Tony remained speechless, although for entirely different reasons.

Tony found himself burying his face into hands, a guilty aura all around him. He didn’t remember that interview. He really didn’t. He was caught off guard in an early hour. Maybe the coffee he was drinking was his first and Steve should know better than to let him out of the house without his morning coffee. Yes, he should just blame it all on Steve, it was a good plan—

It was a terrible, terrible plan. He should man up and just apologize. And then call the network and cease the transmission and burn the tape. Maybe Pepper was already on it.

“Steve, I—” Tony turned to his husband, a profound apology already forming on the tip of his tongue which he was not given a permission to say. There were hands on his cheeks, warm lips on his lips, and a tongue breaching in, claiming every inch. Through half-lidded eyes Tony saw how narrowed and dark Steve’s eyes were, a clear sign of—

Oh. Oooh.

Maybe he should give interviews while half asleep more often.

“Booo! Get a room!”

They didn’t have to hear it twice. With a laugh, Tony felt himself being hoisted up and carried away bridal style by Steve, clearly in a hurry to get to their bedroom.

Tony couldn’t stop the goofy smile.

“You are still in trouble for that interview,” Steve huffed out, muting other voices and not paying attention to what their team was yelling after them.

“Oh, I know,” Tony confirmed. He had a feeling it was a good kind of being in trouble.

The voice coming from the TV focused everyone’s attention back on the screen. The on-screen Steve started to talk.

“I think he would take a rope, a knife and— that’s it. That’s all he needs. He could get the rest on the island.”

“Good thing you didn’t say matches, I could make a fire on my own,” Tony grinned, pleased with the answer.

“Of course you could,” Steve agreed for the sake of agreeing, hearing a displeased murmur from their teammates. Where was the dirt?

“Hmmm… Steve would take…”

The screen switched showing Tony. Everyone looked hopeful, hoping for some juicer answer.

“He would take a rope—”

“Boring!” Clint hollered, as it seemed that the question would be answered in the same practical way as Steve did.

“— and lube and me.”

Oh.

“We would have some good time.”

The on-screen Tony nonchalantly sipped his coffee, while the real-life Tony opened his mouth in shock in a general murmur of approval coming from the team. He didn’t remember saying that. Steve also gaped at the TV, feeling his face burn.

From that point, it only got worse.

“What is your favorite thing in your partner?” the second question showed in bold letters.

“Oh gosh,” Steve smiled sweetly and scratched the back of his head, looking shy. It would be innocent if the movement didn’t pronounce his enormous biceps, which seemed like a very fan-service moment. “Tony is smart, caring and funny. He is a whole package. I love everything about him, so I guess Tony altogether is my favorite thing.”

“Sappy,” Pietro gruffed, while Wanda cooed, like most of the team. Bucky made some gagging noise over the sweetness, and Steve aimed a light kick at his friend’s back.

Then the TV showed Tony.

“His *BLEEP*,” the on-screen Tony blurted out without a second of hesitation. Although the word was censored, the mouth movement was clear and the whole team burst into laughter. “Okay, I am joking,” Tony backtracked, smiling charmingly. “His heart. He is a good man. But he does have an amazing *BLEEP*.”

“What?” Tony asked in a shaky voice, getting nervous under Steve’s reprimanding look. “I fixed it!”

“You definitely did,” Clint cackled.

Steve feared for the last question. Well, not a question…

“Whaaat?” the on-screen Steve laughed nervously, his eyes crinkling. “No, no way. I am not doing it.”

Ah, so it was a task.

“Really?” Tony said, lowering his sunglasses again. “You really want me to do it?” he asked, his smile and whole posture giving away that he would.

The team held its breath waiting for the reveal what the task could be.

On the screen on a cheerful background of colorful stripes showed the last question of the interview. A task.

“Pretend that what you are holding is your partner and make out with it.”

The on-screen Steve looked at the water bottle in his hand.

“No,” he denied taking part in the challenge looking harshly into the camera, an embarrassed smile quickly following. “No,” he repeated, shaking his head.

“Alright,” the on-screen Tony nodded enthusiastically. “Just come with the camera closer. Like, get my whole face in. Closer. Perfect.”

And so on the background of a busy New York street, Tony put the coffee cup closer to his face and closed his eyes. A tip of a pink tongue touched the bottom and then slowly traced all the way up, going up the middle of the shield on the cup, lingering at the rim and doing a half circle. Then he tipped the cup all the way up, holding it almost vertically, downing down the contents in big gulps, his neck stretched and Adam’s apple moving temptingly.

The room turned very, very quiet. When Tony was done, he lowered the cup with a satisfied breath and wiped his shiny lips with a top of a hand. All the time looking into the camera.

There would be gifsets of this for sure all over the Internet soon.

The show was ending and the team started cheering and commenting, congratulating the couple a good show. Both Steve and Tony remained speechless, although for entirely different reasons.

Tony found himself burying his face into hands, a guilty aura all around him. He didn’t remember that interview. He really didn’t. He was caught off guard in an early hour. Maybe the coffee he was drinking was his first and Steve should know better than to let him out of the house without his morning coffee. Yes, he should just blame it all on Steve, it was a good plan—

It was a terrible, terrible plan. He should man up and just apologize. And then call the network and cease the transmission and burn the tape. Maybe Pepper was already on it.

“Steve, I—” Tony turned to his husband, a profound apology already forming on the tip of his tongue which he was not given a permission to say. There were hands on his cheeks, warm lips on his lips, and a tongue breaching in, claiming every inch. Through half-lidded eyes Tony saw how narrowed and dark Steve’s eyes were, a clear sign of—

Oh. Oooh.

Maybe he should give interviews while half asleep more often.

“Booo! Get a room!”

They didn’t have to hear it twice. With a laugh, Tony felt himself being hoisted up and carried away bridal style by Steve, clearly in a hurry to get to their bedroom.

Tony couldn’t stop the goofy smile.

“You are still in trouble for that interview,” Steve huffed out, muting other voices and not paying attention to what their team was yelling after them.

“Oh, I know,” Tony confirmed. He had a feeling it was a good kind of being in trouble.

“It is on, it is on!” Clint yelled, ceasing the chatter and bringing everyone’s attention to the enormous TV set and the starting show. The show opened with glimpses of interviews, showing funny or memorable moments in a retrospective, many famous faces appearing on the screen.

“I can’t believe you don’t remember giving this interview,” Steve murmured, looking at his husband with gentle bewilderment, that hid a lot of fondness. Actually, he could believe that. Tony seemed to never pay a lot of mind about what he was telling to the press, almost as if he didn’t have any filter. He probably didn’t.

[[MORE]]

“Unlike Steve. He can’t handle a camera in his face,” Bucky murmured from his splayed on the floor position, with his face smushed into Sam’s bicep. The Winter Soldier didn’t sleep well in the last days.

Sam laughed, jostling Bucky a bit who grumbled loudly in protest. Like a sleepy bear. “Can’t wait to see him get all red and splutter words out. Please tell me that will happen.”

“Welcome to the Celebrity Couples Interview! This time we have a real treat for you, the first superhero couple who public deemed with the proud name Superhusbands, also known as Stony—”

“Aw, Stony is a cute name,” Sam laughed, sending Steve a wide smile. “Kinda makes you imagine stone statues of you two all over New York.”

“No,” Steve said quickly, shaking his head for double emphasis, just at the moment Tony opened his mouth. No statues.

“It is a noble term, my friends,” Thor rumbled from his favorite armchair.

“Hey, there goes Steve!” Sam yelled, ceasing the chatter and pointing at the screen with the image of a path in the park. It was almost empty and the sun wasn’t too high yet and dew was sparkling on the grass.

“Hey! There he is! Go go go!”

The camera angle changed and the pace quickened as two people started running. Soon, Steve’s silhouette appeared in the camera’s view, as he was during his morning jog, wearing a grey, clingy t-shirt and drawstring pants.

The team whistled, and Steve blushed a bit at that. Captain America looked good in tight clothes.

“Captain! Captain Rogers! May we have a word with you?!”

Steve turned around, temporarily jogging in place, blinking surprised at the camera. Usually when people jog they turn red and sweaty and disgusting. Steve wasn’t one of them. His face was just a bit pink, and his hair got a little bit damp near the hairline. His lips were flushed, as Steve had a habit of licking his lips while working out. It wasn’t a typical workout look. Steve looked hot and sweet, like a freshly baked cinabbon.

“That’s my husband,” Tony said proudly, grunting at the elbow aimed at his stomach from the said husband.

Back on the screen, Steve showed all of his teeth in a wide smile, a quite unusual reaction at seeing a camera when it came to him.

“Sure! If you can catch me, that is!” after the words, Steve turned around and zoomed out from the view, camera soon on him, showing his silhouette getting smaller and smaller.

“Noo! Captain, please wait!” more footsteps and the clinking of high heels the presenter wore was perfectly hearable. The image of the presenter and cameraman, chasing Captain America made the team laugh.

“Little shit,” Sam commented the behavior and Tony smiled at Steve’s mischievous, yet somehow proud smile.

“Mister Stark!”

The TV showed Tony, walking out of one of the coffee places in downtown, holding a stainless steel coffee cup with an outline of Captain America shield pressed on the side. He was in a formal, dark blue suit, with a white shirt underneath and a tie. There was even a handkerchief in his breast pocket, and the look was completed with expensive sunglasses and even more expensive wristwatch, matching the whole set. A true businessman at his finest.

“Oh, were you between meetings?” Steve asked, and Tony paused for a second, before looking away.

“Yeah, between meetings,” Tony agreed, not sounding too convincing and Steve only narrowed eyes. Tony better hope that Pepper was not watching this show.

“Mister Stark, can we have a word with you?”

The on-screen Tony slowly lowered his sunglasses, brown eyes sparkling in the sun. He smiled slowly, one corner of his lips going higher than the other, accented by the sharp and fresh angles of his goatee.

“Sure.”

“You would just agree to anything to stay away from SI meetings,” Natasha chimed in, clearly seeing how on-screen Tony planned to take his sweet time with answering questions and having an excuse for being late.

“Time for the questions!” Wanda called, holding a bowl of popcorn for her and Pietro to share. “He would take a rope—”

“Boring!” Clint hollered, as it seemed that the question would be answered in the same practical way as Steve did.

“— and lube and me.”

“No,” he denied taking part in the challenge looking harshly into the camera, an embarrassed smile quickly following. “No,” he repeated, shaking his head.

body:

blog.title: Dancing In The Moonlight
blog.description: Out of order Winteriron and Ironwidow drabbles. An amateur female!Toni enthusiast and writer.

summary: There’s a gravestone in the backyard. It’s crooked and misshapen, leaning against the uneven fencing. The patch of grass around...
body:
There’s a gravestone in the backyard. It’s crooked and misshapen, leaning against the uneven fencing. The patch of grass around it is the healthiest in the yard. Obviously cared for. 

Bucky doesn’t know who it belongs to, he’s just seen it through the window. Toni doesn’t talk about it, but sometimes her eyes linger on where it can be seen. When she does she looks like she did when Bucky met her. 

It’s during one of these instances that he brings it up. 

“Whose stone is that?” he asks quietly. 

She freezes and Bucky feels awful for asking. Her face is drawn as if she’s in pain. 

“A friend’s,” she responds. 

His stomach drops, he can’t imagine having to go through something like that. 

“I’m sorry I asked.” 

“No, I should’ve brought him up.” 

“Do you want to talk about it?” 

He rests a hand on hers, hoping it’s comforting. Her hand flexes under his as she mulls it over. 

“His name was Rhodey. He was my best friend.” She swallowed. “I loved him.”

The silence is resounding. 

“What happened?” 

“I was gone for too long.” 

“Is that why you stay here?” 

Her head whips around, clearly startled. 

“How did you figure that out?” she asks, panicked. 

“I wouldn’t leave much either if leaving is what got Stevie killed.” 

As soon as the words are out of Bucky’s mouth, he regrets it. Toni looks stricken. Then the tears start flowing, her face is ruddy when she buries her face in his chest, sobbing. He stumbles a few steps back but she clings. He holds her back just as tight. 

“I didn’t mean to,” she pleads, probably with Rhodey. 

“Of course you didn’t,” he responds soothingly. 

It doesn’t matter if he doesn’t know the whole story. He can tell it isn’t her fault with the way she mumbles the same words over and over. 

Bucky shouldn’t have asked.

This is one of the best examples of how...
body:
Rhodey: *at Tony Stark* You don’t respect yourself, so I know you don’t respect me.



This is one of the best examples of how Rhodey and Tony’s relationship truly is. Rhodey knows about Tony’s true feelings towards himself and knows how that plays out towards the rest of the world. One of the best forms of a BROTP ever.

so you know how infinity war starts off right where ragnarok post-credit scenes end right

it starts and all we see is the hanging radio and scott’s voice screaming where hank, hope and janet went

and then we see him in the subatomic world getting sucked into a time vortex, passing out, then waking up in the battle of new york and then it cuts out and goes back to whoever

*insert the whole supposed time stone theory and them going back in time to get the tesseract scene here*

things are going horribly wrong and all of a sudden giAntMan is just There in all his glory and he’s like “‘Whats up Cap? Stark? You guys friends again?”

and THATS how we end up with this scene
